image.altText: Signage for the ANU.

props.synopsis: The prestige of the Australian National University is fast fading. It must now respond to explosive allegations.

title.children: How one of the world's most prestigious universities fell from grace

image.altText: A close up of a high school student.

props.synopsis: More than 30 ACT schools will have better access to period products with the expansion of an ACT government pilot program.

title.children: Student's fight to end period poverty brings free pads into more schools

image.altText: Julie Bishop wearing a red dress, speaking on stage while sitting

props.synopsis: ACT independent Senator David Pocock says he is concerned the issues facing the Australian National University are affecting its staff and students and calls for more transparency.

title.children: Bishop should stand aside from ANU role amid bullying claim, senator says

image.altText: Bottles of Pepsi are pictured at a grocery store in California.

props.synopsis: A bid by the Australian Tax Office to impose taxes on American soft drink giant PepsiCo has failed comprehensively, with the High Court throwing out the case.

title.children: High Court throws out ATO's case against soft drink giant PepsiCo

image.altText: Andrew Laming talks to the media at Parliament House

props.synopsis: Andrew Laming was the LNP member for Bowman in Queensland when the Australian Electoral Commission took issue with his Facebook posts.

title.children: Former MP Andrew Laming wins High Court appeal over Facebook post fines

image.altText: Max and berts burnt

props.synopsis: Two heritage huts in the Namadgi National Park will not be rebuilt in an ACT government backflip, which experts say goes against heritage guidance and has left family and friends involved feeling betrayed.

title.children: 'Like a gravestone': The heritage huts that won't rise again

image.altText: A woman wearing a denim jacket sitting at a desk with a microphone.

props.synopsis: Former member of the Australian National University council Liz Allen has used a Senate inquiry investigating university governance to allege Chancellor Julie Bishop harassed, bullied, and threatened her.

title.children: Julie Bishop accused of bullying by ANU staff member, senate inquiry hears

image.altText: A man with short brown hair wearing a red and blue checkered shirt stands in front of a courthouse looking serious.

props.synopsis: The ACT Supreme Court hears a harrowing account from a child sex abuse survivor in which his life has been "shattered", with the trauma made worse by a years-long delay in having his case heard.

title.children: Child sex abuse survivor calls for urgent case management reform

image.altText: An older couple stands outside their suburban home and smiles.

props.synopsis: Transport Minister Chris Steel has written to the toll operator asking it to provide refunds to affected ACT motorists who were issued with toll notices for trips they did not take, due to similarities between licence plates.

title.children: Canberra drivers wrongly charged for trips on Sydney toll roads

image.altText: A man wearing a white shirt and black tie walking out of court.

props.synopsis: The jury in Matt Wright's criminal trial has heard the crocodile wrangler visited a seriously injured pilot in a Brisbane hospital and asked him to "manipulate" flight hours. Follow live.

title.children: TV star deleted things from hospitalised pilot's phone, jury hears

image.altText: CBA logo on black wall next to yellow tiled wall

props.synopsis: Australia's biggest company CBA has posted a $10.13 billion net profit but billions were wiped off the bank's share price, as analysts say the stock was "priced for perfection".

title.children: Commonwealth Bank profit tops $10 billion but not enough to justify 'lofty valuation'

image.altText: Giant screen on the wall of the ASX, with large red numbers, showing the price of shares which have fallen.

props.synopsis: The Australian share market has slipped from its record high as Commonwealth Bank reports a $10.1 billion annual profit. Wall Street breaks new records after the latest US inflation data reveals Donald Trump's tariffs have not resulted in much higher consumer prices yet. Follow live.

title.children: Australian share market closes in red as CBA posts worst fall since April — as it happened

image.altText: Woman in AFP uniform around plants

props.synopsis: The Australian Federal Police said officers responded to a request for assistance from an airline at Sudney Airport after the man was "acting suspiciously" this morning.

title.children: Man charged after police gun fired at Sydney Airport during arrest

image.altText: Signage at a Telstra store in Sydney.

props.synopsis: About 100,000 Telstra customers in southern NSW were without internet and phone coverage for more than an hour after an incident at the telco's North Nowra exchange site.

title.children: 100,000 Telstra customers back online after widespread outage in NSW

image.altText: A composite image showing three people featured against a computer-generated backdrop

props.synopsis: The Productivity Commission's interim report on AI has triggered a fierce backlash from the literary community.

title.children: Authors warn AI copyright exception a 'free pass' for Big Tech to steal work

image.altText: A woman speaks to the media.

props.synopsis: Sussan Ley says Anthony Albanese is "out of his depth" after reports Hamas has welcomed Australia's plan to recognise a Palestinian state.

title.children: Minister says she's 'not surprised' by Hamas 'propaganda' — as it happened

image.altText: Maroubra Housing

props.synopsis: Australia is now a "home owner's welfare state", leading economists argue, and if the tax treatment of housing were reformed, the nation as a whole would benefit.

title.children: Australia is a 'home owners' welfare state'. Taxing the family home may be the answer

image.altText: A children's toy bear laying sideways on a floor.

props.synopsis: A string of regulatory failings saw a Victorian childcare worker retain a legal clearance to work with children — despite being blacklisted from the industry after an investigation found he was grooming toddlers.

title.children: Childcare worker who 'groomed toddlers' to lose Working with Children Check

image.altText: Graphics image of officer wearing uniform wearing a face mask and behind him a police vehicle and flag with the blue line in it

props.synopsis: The former police supervisor of Zachary Rolfe publicly displayed a symbol linked to far-right extremist groups on his Facebook page until last week, when the ABC notified his bosses.

title.children: Police officer with 'racist attitudes' displayed symbol linked to white supremacists

image.altText: A man stands on a busy market street with a looming coal plant's cooling towers in the background.

props.synopsis: China has put its economic might behind renewable technologies in a desire to stop relying on imported fossil fuels.

title.children: China's green energy boom could spell the end of the fossil fuel age

image.altText: A large billboard with Russian writing on it is seen near a local road on an overcast day.

props.synopsis: You don't have to look far in Russia to find hypotheses as to why Alaska is in the wrong hands. Whether Moscow could ever rule it again depends on who you talk to.

title.children: Inside Russia's claim to Alaska, from 'mythology' in schools to a 90s hit

image.altText: Mark Latham in a black coat and orange time walking

props.synopsis: In one recent social media post, Mark Latham suggested that the NCAT case involved an "absurd proposition" that Alex Greenwich should "never be publicly criticised".

title.children: Latham tells tribunal MPs 'have disagreements all the time'

image.altText: James Crisp x

props.synopsis: A father and son were accused of preying on victims at a Catholic boarding school but only one was charged.  Now they are both behind bars.

title.children: Father and son jailed decades after role in alleged school paedophile ring

image.altText: Kitchen worker uses tongs in a pub kitchen in Sydney.

props.synopsis: The peak union group says a shorter work week would improve productivity and reduce burnout, adding workers should also be able to share in the spoils of the expected artificial intelligence boom.

title.children: Peak union body calls for four-day work week

image.altText: A sketch of a man with dark hair and a dark beard in a dark t-shirt.

props.synopsis: The man accused of murdering Athena Georgopoulos and her partner Andrew Gunn at a unit in Mount Waverley on Monday night faces court for the first time.

title.children: Man accused of murdering pregnant woman and partner faces Melbourne court

image.altText: Andrew Laming talks to the media at Parliament House

props.synopsis: Andrew Laming was the LNP member for Bowman in Queensland when the Australian Electoral Commission took issue with his Facebook posts.

title.children: Former MP Andrew Laming wins High Court appeal over Facebook post fines

image.altText: Dead sea life under the water, grey clouds above the water

props.synopsis: An Indigenous elder calls on the government to take more action on SA's toxic algal bloom as Environment Minister Murray Watt and Opposition Leader Sussan Ley both visit the state.

title.children: SA's algal bloom devastation like watching 'Uluru being destroyed'

image.altText: A woman wearing a dress leans against a man wearing a brown military uniform

props.synopsis: Northern NSW resident Cherry Watts was washing her newborn sister's nappies when her city was destroyed by an atomic bomb at the end of World War II.

title.children: Hiroshima atomic bomb survivor is country town's 'national treasure'

image.altText: The entrance of the El Caballo theme park.

props.synopsis: An Indigenous organisation is demanding $21 million in compensation from the trustee which oversaw the purchase of an ageing horse ranch after an investigation found the trustee "breached its duties".

title.children: El Caballo sold for big loss on Perth's outskirts after failed housing plan

image.altText: A top-down photo shows a person holding a cup of coffee with latte art.

props.synopsis: The spike in coffee prices around the world means consumers are likely to pay more for their morning flat white, but it could prove a boom time for Australian growers.

title.children: Australian coffee in demand as international prices soar

image.altText: An image of a man with glasses and grey hair inset against an emergency department sign and a hospital building.

props.synopsis: A coroner rules a dementia patient who disappeared from a regional Queensland hospital in 2023, never to be seen again, died from dehydration. It prompted security changes, but did not stop similar incidents.

title.children: Dementia patient walks out of hospital never to be seen again

image.altText: Piles of timber and brick waste on a blank piece of land in the Mallee. The dirt is dry and brown with a few green shrubs.

props.synopsis: An Adelaide demolition company and its director are found guilty of illegally dumping thousands of tonnes of asbestos-contaminated waste.

title.children: Demolition firm ordered to pay $700k for illegally dumping asbestos

image.altText: A sandstone cliff line landslide with rocks at the bottom.

props.synopsis: One of the largest Blue Mountains rockfalls in recent years shaves off two notorious climbing routes that were never repeated after the first climbers established them.

title.children: Carne Wall landslide wipes out notoriously difficult Blue Mountains climb

image.altText: A man sitting in hotel smiling

props.synopsis: Iranian-American comedy veteran Maz Jobrani believes the US president is trying to censor free speech in the United States, and he intends to hit back.

title.children: 'The emperor has no clothes': Comedian Maz Jobrani hits back at Trump

image.altText: A dark coloured pig in a paddock.

props.synopsis: A pig control program in a known West Australian problem area has killed 12,000 pigs in six months, leaving farmers and experts stunned.

title.children: Record pig kill shocks farmers struggling with damage from pest
